means: 使一体化( integrate的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: He thinks we are living in a fully integrated, supportive society.
sentence.Network_cn: 他认为我们生活在一个完全和谐、相互扶持的社会里。

sentence.Network_en: There is, he said, a lack of an integrated national transport policy.
sentence.Network_cn: 他指出，目前缺乏一个统一的全国交通运输政策。

entry.tran: (机构)取消种族隔离的，平等对待的
entry.def: An integrated institution is intended for use by all races or religious groups.

example.ex: We believe that pupils of integrated schools will have more tolerant attitudes.
example.tran: 我们相信在取消种族隔离的学校就读的学生会有更宽容的态度。

means.word_mean: 1. formed or united into a whole
2. formed into a whole or introduced into another entity;

sentences.sentence: "a more closely integrated economic and political system"- Dwight D.Eisenhower

means.word_mean: 3. not segregated; designated as available to all races or groups;
4. resembling a living organism in organization or development;

means.word_mean: 整体的；完全的；综合的；集成的；整合的

sentences.en: This is a semiconductor integrated circuit.
sentences.cn: 这是一个半导体集成电路。

sentences.en: This computer program can be integrated with existing programs.
sentences.cn: 这套计算机程序可以与现有的程序整合在一起。

sentences.en: Immigrants are integrated into the community.
sentences.cn: 移民与该地区的居民融为一体。

sentences.en: The residential blocks were integrated with the rest of the college.
sentences.cn: 住宿区与学院连在了一起。

sentences.en: They soon became fully integrated into the local community.
sentences.cn: 他们很快就完全融入了当地人的圈子。

sentences.en: a highly integrated approach to planning
sentences.cn: 高度协调的制订计划方法
